body.p:
Stanford Ky. June 5, 1865
Hon. Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Last winter, you sent a commissioner for Jos. E. Severance as Police Judge of the town of Stanford, but after it arrived he was unwilling the accept the office, and declined being qualified. The consequence is that we are still without a Police Judge, much to our inconvenience. We therefore beg you to send us a commission for James R. Warren as said Judge to act till the next regular ^election^. By so doing you will greatly oblige &c

J. N. Craig } Pres. of Board of Trustees
C. Barnes } Clerk of Board

By order of the Board
C. B. Clk.
Police Judge
Stanford
apptd
Jas. R. Warren
10th June/65
